topics.name: Expressions and combining like terms
topics.content: Identify parts of an expression, combine like terms, and simplify expressions using the distributive property.

topics.name: Exponents and radicals
topics.content: Apply the laws of exponents to simplify expressions with integer exponents and radicals.

topics.name: Operations with polynomials
topics.content: Add, subtract, and multiply polynomials; factor quadratic and higher-degree polynomials.

topics.name: Linear equations
topics.content: Solve single-variable linear equations and understand slope-intercept, point-slope and standard forms.

topics.name: Systems of equations
topics.content: Solve systems of linear equations using graphing, substitution and elimination methods.

topics.name: Inequalities
topics.content: Solve and graph linear inequalities and compound inequalities.

topics.name: Functions
topics.content: Understand function notation, domain and range; evaluate and graph linear, piecewise and exponential functions.

topics.name: Quadratic functions
topics.content: Analyze quadratic functions in standard, vertex and factored form; solve quadratic equations by factoring, completing the square and quadratic formula.

topics.name: Lines and angles
topics.content: Explore parallel and perpendicular lines, angle relationships and basic constructions.

topics.name: Triangle congruence
topics.content: Prove triangles congruent using SSS, SAS, ASA, AAS and HL criteria; use rigid motions.

topics.name: Similarity and right triangles
topics.content: Use dilations and similarity theorems; apply the Pythagorean theorem and trigonometric ratios in right triangles.

topics.name: Polygons and quadrilaterals
topics.content: Classify polygons, examine properties of parallelograms, trapezoids and special quadrilaterals.

topics.name: Circles
topics.content: Investigate chords, arcs, tangents and inscribed angles; use circle theorems to find measures.

topics.name: Area and volume
topics.content: Calculate perimeter, area and surface area of 2-D figures; find volume of prisms, cylinders, pyramids and cones.

topics.name: Limits and properties
topics.content: Evaluate limits graphically and algebraically; use limit laws and special limits.

topics.name: Continuity and the Intermediate Value Theorem
topics.content: Determine continuity and apply the Intermediate Value Theorem to justify solutions.

topics.name: Definition and rules
topics.content: Understand the derivative as an instantaneous rate of change; compute derivatives using power, product, quotient and chain rules.

topics.name: Applications of derivatives
topics.content: Analyze motion, related rates, optimization and curve sketching using derivatives.

topics.name: Definite integrals and the Fundamental Theorem
topics.content: Approximate area under a curve with Riemann sums; evaluate definite integrals; apply the Fundamental Theorem of Calculus.

topics.name: Differential equations and accumulation
topics.content: Solve basic differential equations and apply models for exponential growth and decay; compute areas and volumes.

topics.name: Chemistry of life
topics.content: Describe the properties of water and macromolecules (carbohydrates, lipids, proteins and nucleic acids).

topics.name: Cell structure and function
topics.content: Identify organelles, cell membranes and transport mechanisms; compare prokaryotic and eukaryotic cells.

topics.name: Cellular energetics
topics.content: Explain enzyme function and metabolism; describe photosynthesis and cellular respiration.

topics.name: Heredity
topics.content: Understand meiosis, Mendelian genetics, non‑Mendelian inheritance and genetic variation.

topics.name: Gene expression and regulation
topics.content: Learn about DNA replication, transcription, translation and gene regulation; explore biotechnology.

topics.name: Natural selection
topics.content: Investigate Darwin’s theory, population genetics, speciation and evidence for evolution.

topics.name: Ecological interactions
topics.content: Study population dynamics, energy flow, nutrient cycles and community interactions.

topics.name: Biodiversity and ecosystems
topics.content: Examine ecosystem stability, succession and the impact of environmental change.

topics.name: States of matter and properties
topics.content: Describe solids, liquids and gases; interpret phase changes and properties such as density and solubility.

topics.name: Atomic structure and periodicity
topics.content: Understand atomic models, electron configuration and periodic trends.

topics.name: Bonding and molecular structure
topics.content: Compare ionic, covalent and metallic bonding; predict shapes and polarity using VSEPR and electronegativity.

topics.name: Stoichiometry
topics.content: Balance chemical equations; perform calculations involving moles, mass and limiting reactants.

topics.name: Types of reactions and thermochemistry
topics.content: Classify synthesis, decomposition, combustion and redox reactions; explore enthalpy changes and calorimetry.

topics.name: Kinetics and equilibrium
topics.content: Examine factors affecting reaction rates; use equilibrium constants and Le Chatelier’s principle.

topics.name: Acids, bases and electrochemistry
topics.content: Define pH and pKa; explore acid–base reactions and titrations; understand electrochemical cells.

topics.name: Thermodynamics and nuclear chemistry
topics.content: Study entropy, free energy and spontaneity; explore nuclear reactions and applications.

topics.name: Kinematics
topics.content: Describe motion in one and two dimensions; use position, velocity and acceleration graphs; analyse projectile motion.

topics.name: Dynamics
topics.content: Apply Newton’s laws; analyse friction, tension, normal and gravitational forces.

topics.name: Momentum and energy
topics.content: Understand impulse and momentum conservation; explore work, kinetic and potential energy, power and energy conservation.

topics.name: Circular motion and gravitation
topics.content: Relate uniform circular motion to centripetal force; understand Newton’s law of universal gravitation.

topics.name: Waves and sound
topics.content: Explore wave properties, interference, standing waves and the Doppler effect.

topics.name: Electricity and magnetism
topics.content: Investigate electrostatics, electric fields, circuits, magnetism and electromagnetic induction.

topics.name: Quantum and atomic physics
topics.content: Discuss wave–particle duality, atomic models and the photoelectric effect.

topics.name: Relativity and nuclear physics
topics.content: Describe special relativity, mass–energy equivalence and nuclear reactions.

topics.name: Reading comprehension
topics.content: Develop skills to identify main ideas, themes, and evidence in literary and informational texts.

topics.name: Literary analysis
topics.content: Analyse character, setting, plot, tone and figurative language; explore themes such as coming of age and the hero’s journey.

topics.name: Argumentative and informative writing
topics.content: Plan and write structured essays with clear theses, supporting evidence and coherent paragraphs.

topics.name: Narrative and creative writing
topics.content: Develop narrative techniques, dialogue, pacing and descriptive details in storytelling.

topics.name: Research skills
topics.content: Conduct research, evaluate sources, cite evidence and produce reports or research papers.

topics.name: Conventions and grammar
topics.content: Master standard English grammar, usage and mechanics.

topics.name: Speaking and listening
topics.content: Engage in collaborative discussions; deliver presentations with effective organization and clarity.

topics.name: Vocabulary development
topics.content: Build academic and domain-specific vocabulary through context and word study strategies.

topics.name: Getting started and debugging
topics.content: Set up a programming environment and practice basic debugging strategies.

topics.name: Variables and data types
topics.content: Declare and use variables; understand data types such as integers, floats, strings and booleans.

topics.name: Input and output
topics.content: Use input/output functions to interact with the user and display results.

topics.name: Conditional statements
topics.content: Use if/else statements to make decisions and control program flow.

topics.name: Loops
topics.content: Write for and while loops to repeat operations over sequences or based on conditions.

topics.name: Functions and modularity
topics.content: Define and call functions to organize code and reuse logic.

topics.name: Arrays and lists
topics.content: Store and manipulate collections of data using arrays or lists.

topics.name: Classes and objects
topics.content: Understand classes as blueprints for objects; create and use objects with attributes and methods.

topics.name: Collections and libraries
topics.content: Work with built-in collections such as dictionaries and sets; explore standard libraries.
